system.biography:
TitleFFF 703-1 Shek Pvar Jmorvi
Birthday4 Nolus 687
AppearanceAge 33, height 5’11”, medium frame, weight 165 lb, plain appearance, medium complexion, brown hair, violet eyes
Medical/PsycheBirthmark (port wine stain over the right side of his head)
Size6
ArmorFine cloth tunic, leggings and felt hat, leather cowl, vambraces, gauntlets, belt and calf boots, dagger and staff.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box
Valuables£3 in gold, 106d in silver coin, silver necklace (163d), two silver links dangling from his hat (326d each, see notes)
NotesThe two silver links on his hat are Jmorvi Foci. Together they grant +10% to CML (the links heat up when activated)

Biography

Life is good for Maccus. The son of a wealthy and successful silversmith, he grew up in a life of privilege. His mother owns a franchise in Charafir and often sells to the royal court. From a young age, Maccus showed unusual skills. Not fine dexterity or excellent vision, but rather an amazing feel for metals, particularly silver to which he was strangely drawn. One day while working in his mother’s shop, he met a very strange man who seemed quite taken with him. The man met with his mother privately and agreed to send him to an apprenticeship in Glenoth.

The man turned out to be a Jmorvi Viran. He saw in Maccus great magic potential. Maccus spent many years at the chantry. He excelled in the arts of the foundry, especially in purifying and casting silver. He was made a Satia-Mavari in 717TR. He has spent the last three years roaming Hârn honing his skills. Maccus has developed two unique spells. The first seals the molds so they take the perfect shape and release the cast flawlessly. The second allows him to purify silver to 99.99% pure.

In his travels, Maccus encountered the Gargu-Kyani (white orcs) on the Genin Trail. Using magic to speak their language, he established a mutually beneficial arrangement. In return for gold nuggets from the mountains, he traded them beautifully wrought pieces of silver jewelry. The Gargu-Kyani are obsessed by Maccus’ work and trade with him at a significant disadvantage. Maccus easily makes a 50% profit on every transaction. This has made him very wealthy, though he keeps the source of his

wealth secret.

Adventure Hooks

Sturdy Fellows. A rather homely looking man with strange eyes and a pleasant voice approaches the PCs. He explains that he is moving some valuables and needs an escort. The PCs have been recommended as trustworthy and dependable.

Those Are My Customers. The PCs are waging war against the Gargu-Kyani and winning. Maccus has an excellent business relationship with this particular tribe. They beg him for help. Suddenly, the gargun are better organized, fighting with very sophisticated tactics and carry human weapons. Something is going on.

Easily Portable Wealth. The PCs have come into some valuables, but they need to trade them for something more portable. An acquaintance recommends Maccus. His silver jewelry is beautiful, compact, readily resalable and valuable.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
